item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: FlowTracker – Track data flowing through Java programs (65 points | 6 comments)
2. Porting SBCL to the Nintendo Switch (13 points | discuss)
3. JG Ballard's Apocalyptic Art (15 points | discuss)
4. Better-performing “25519” elliptic-curve cryptography (125 points | 34 comments)
5. FDA Authorizes First Over-the-Counter Hearing Aid Software (217 points | 80 comments)
6. I fixed the strawberry problem because OpenAI couldn't (55 points | 35 comments)
7. Boeing workers vote to strike (301 points | 198 comments)
8. How to Spot NASA's Solar Sail Demonstration Streaking Through the Night Sky (51 points | 2 comments)
9. Breaking Down OnlyFans' Economics (223 points | 296 comments)
10. Notes on OpenAI's new o1 chain-of-thought models (479 points | 391 comments)
11. The Spellbinding Life of Koji Kashin: Japan's Legendary Wandering Magician (11 points | 4 comments)
12. Entire staff of game publisher Annapurna Interactive has reportedly resigned (193 points | 78 comments)
13. Show HN: A whiteboard that writes math equations (42 points | 25 comments)
14. DiyPresso: DIY Espresso Machine (130 points | 142 comments)
15. Data sleuths who spotted research misconduct cleared of defamation (464 points | 82 comments)
16. Exploring the scalable matrix extension of the Apple M4 processor (89 points | 6 comments)

18. The Magnetic Field of the Milky Way (2000) (61 points | 17 comments)
19. Notepat – Aesthetic Computer (112 points | 26 comments)
20. Fall of the wild: why pristine wilderness is a human-made myth (5 points | discuss)
21. F3 – Fight Flash Fraud (104 points | 39 comments)
22. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (820 points | 367 comments)
23. Why Haskell? (372 points | 497 comments)
24. Does your startup need complex cloud infrastructure? (192 points | 188 comments)
25. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (248 points | 73 comments)
26. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (166 points | 92 comments)
27. Imbue (Formerly Generally Intelligent) (YC S17) Is Hiring Software Engineers ( | hide)
28. The Strange Case of the Rogue HP-12c Calculator (89 points | 19 comments)
29. Who Owns Nebula? (174 points | 45 comments)
30. If I could dissect a sauropod (128 points | 16 comments)
